Author: Leo Parrish
Title: âœ…âœ…âœ… [ANN] [ICO] ğŸ“¦RETAIL.GLOBAL - White Label Solution Powering Global Sales ğŸŒ
Body: Retail.Global are going to adopt the best practice from Walmart, JD.com, Rakuten, Unilever and American Express in the blockchain field  https://cdn-images-1.medium.com/max/1000/1*fzhOGBlbkxNP_yK4valHbg.jpeg  Having studied the experience of the global retail companies and professional associations, we have found majors who have already achieved some of their key performance indicators through the blockchain.  A case in point are American Walmart and Chinese JD.com creating a blockchain based retail chain to let their customers know the origin of the items they buy.  This will also save on supply management, as soon as all parties trust the blockchain: manufacturers, distributors and transportation agents.  - Japanese Rakuten and American Express migrate their loyalty programs to the blockchain for more customer involvement and easier integration of external partners - Unilever, the global major, made the first step in increasing transparency and reducing advertising costs within its blockchain partnership with IBM. - However, the blockchain solutions are only available to major businesses due to the high cost of development and the lack of developers in the market.  We have everything now, including the product, the customer and expansion to new markets to offer a blockchain-based product for the retail market, effectively solving their problems and being able to become one of the market leaders.  Our goal is to become a locomotive in the retail blockchain solutions market.

Author: Leo Parrish
Title: âœ…âœ…âœ… [ANN] [ICO] ğŸ“¦RETAIL.GLOBAL - White Label Solution Powering Global Sales ğŸŒ
Body: A brief history of Retail.Global: part 1 We began with our ecommerce company about ten years ago and after we suggested our B2B service we revealed a huge problem for retailers and great opportunity for us  https://cdn-images-1.medium.com/max/1000/1*8xdg73MuohE7e55jZgZD7Q.jpeg  Itâ€™s a real trouble for retailers to organize online sales through brand online store and marketplace. Processes of ecommerce differ strongly from work with retail and wholesale network of stores and the revenue is on average up to 10%.  There are a lot of software, advertising, logistics solutions on the market, but the key problem is consolidation all of them in the one big pack of sales and obtaining a growth of income. Generally brand online store does not give a significant revenue for retailer but takes away a lot of attention from main business.  We suggested a solution in the business-as-a-service format: to give a rights for brandâ€™s domain, access to products stock and after that we will do everything ourselvesâ€Šâ€”â€Šfrom content and advertising to delivering and searching opportunities for growth. Our payment model (percent from real revenue (revenue sharing)) fundamentally differ from other solutions because all contractors of online stores interest only in their revenue but we have the common goal with retailer.  Due to new approach to service and payment we acquired a fourteen customers for a year, they are retail networks of clothes, shoes, sport manufacturers and internet-companies, includes Quiksilver, Ripcurl, Anta, Clarks, Mail.ru Group Ğ¸ Vk.com

Author: Leo Parrish
Title: âœ…âœ…âœ… [ANN] [ICO] ğŸ“¦RETAIL.GLOBAL - White Label Solution Powering Global Sales ğŸŒ
Body: Retail.Global is proud to announce Xiaochen Zhang ( FinTech4Good) as an advisor  https://cdn-images-1.medium.com/max/1000/1*rJgkO7uNM3VZsHdoaDwMlg.png  Retail.Global is very proud to announce a new member of the advisory board: Xiaochen Zhang (China/USA)  Xiaochen Zhangâ€Šâ€”â€ŠPresident of FinTech4Good, Blockchain and FinTech thought leader, board of adviser, keynote speaker, incubator, investor, Host and +20000 followers  He serves on the Crowdfunding Professional Association Board of Directors, UN ESCAP Digital Economy Task Force and as a senior adviser of the China Social Entrepreneurs Foundation and Inter-America Development Bank. He is also the co-chair of the Insurance Blockchain Lab, Smart City Blockchain Lab and Blockchain4SDGs Lab.  He is a keynote speaker for leading blockchain and FinTech Summits and a member of Board of Advisers for some of the most innovative start-ups. He is also a contributor to CCTV, a host of Blockchain Million and FinTech in China Show. He is also mentoring many start-ups for incubators and accelerators from all over the world.  Prior to FinTech4Good, Xiaochen advised government agencies and multinational organizations on innovation, emerging technologies, and investment in positions at the World Bank, United Nations, and other international partnership platforms. He also taught innovation and venture building at leading business schools and served as mentors for many innovative businesses.  And now he helps Retail.Global with international expansion and fundraising

Author: Leo Parrish
Title: âœ…âœ…âœ… [ANN] [ICO] ğŸ“¦RETAIL.GLOBAL - White Label Solution Powering Global Sales ğŸŒ
Body: Last news from Retail.Global team:  https://medium.com/retail-global-ecosystem/retail-global-goes-to-china-c8162fd1134d  Team Retail.Global goes to China https://cdn-images-1.medium.com/max/1000/1*bDtmNs4YVRBn32wg33DL3w.jpeg  Our team starts a roadshow with China and rides to present the project and negotiating with future tokenholders  The presentation at the conference is planned for the presentation of the project and private meetings  Retail.Global is now a platform that creates an online sales channel for retailers and manufacturers around the world  The key difference between Retail.Global and its competitors (Salesforce Commerce / Demandware, SAP / Hybris, Shopify, Adobe / Magento) is that Retail.Global is a business-as-a-service solution for companies, combining: - The ecommerce platform (software), including modules: Supply Chain Management, Orders Management, Omnichannel, Loyalty Reward Program - Ecosystem of connected partners (delivery, payment, content, advertising, analytics, partnerships, suppliers) - Project Management Partners  As a result, customers receive a turnkey sales channel through a revenue sharing payment model, which grows in sales, because continuous development of the platform and ecosystem of partners around the world  Now in the team of 55 people, $ 4mln / revenue and about 15 customers among manufacturers and retailers  As part of Token Sale Retail.Global sells tokens, which can be used: 1) the token is used as a fee for using the platform: â€¢ commission on transactions for the purchase of goods or services based on smart contracts â€¢ commission for using the platform 2) payment for the goods of the shops placed on the platform  Tokenholders also participate in voting: To receive the opinion of the holders of the tokens, a vote is taken, where 1 token is 1 vote. Voting takes place in the closed part of the platform on two issues: 1) The opening of new online stores for startups: the platform bears the costs of opening, developing and advertising an online store and earning only on revenue share, a startup does not pay money at first only with real sales 2) Selection of candidates for a venture fund for retail startups: the fund allocates seed financing and gives access to infrastructure and the ability to test on platform storesâ€Šâ€”â€Ša startup receives financing and development cases, and a platform for new technological solutions  For more information look for site & white paper: https://retail.global
